arm_group.description: group 1 women with stress urinary incontinence by ultrasonography
group 2 women without stress urinary incontinence by ultrasonography

brief_summary.textblock:
Continent women have an intact internal urethral sphincter that extends from the bladder
      neck down to the perineal membrane. The internal urethral sphincter is a strong collagen
      muscle tissue cylinder lined by urothelium. On ultrasound scanning tissue echo will be
      detected torn internal urethral sphincter will not stand sudden rise of abdominal pressure.
      Three dimensional ultrasound assessment of the internal urethral sphincter is very sensitive
      and specific for the diagnosis of stress urinary incontinence.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of the Internal Urethral Sphincter and the Vagina by Three Dimensional Ultrasound
clinical_study.condition: Urinary Incontinence Due to Urethral Sphincter Incompetence

detailed_description.textblock:
The internal urethral sphincter used to be said it's a muscular ring but the investigators
      will visualize by three dimensional ultrasound it's a cylinder in shape and it's the cause
      of stress urinary incontinence by being torn by stretching the vagina during normal
      delivery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  signed an informed consent

          -  patient with stress urinary incontinence

          -  patient have done a vaginal delivery

          -  patient with genital prolapse

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  refusal to sign an informed consent

          -  patient have urinary tract infection

          -  patient with pregnancy

          -  patient have vaginal infection

          -  patient who has undiagnosed vaginal bleeding

clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasonic Assessment of the Urethra and the Vagina in Normal Continent Women and Women Suffering From Stress Urinary Incontinence

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: we are going to do 3d ultrasound by transvaginal probe to see the internal urethral sphincter if torn or not and evaluate the morphology of the urethra and pelvic floor structure
primary_outcome.measure: evaluation of the internal urethral sphincter and assesst the extend and degree of the torn internal urethral sphincter

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

results_reference.citation: Kruger JA, Dietz HP, Budgett SC, Dumoulin CL. Comparison between transperineal ultrasound and digital detection of levator ani trauma. Can we improve the odds? Neurourol Urodyn. 2014 Mar;33(3):307-11. doi: 10.1002/nau.22386. Epub 2013 Feb 22. PubMed

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
